Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Engraulisin (Synthetic AMPs, variant of Pep39, Arg-rich; cell-penetrating, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (84.62%) toPep-39. R: 38%; L: 23%; F: 15%. GRAVY: -0.646; M Wt: 1797.233; M formula: C83H141N31O14, mol ex coeff: 0.Activity:  it inhibited MRSA (MIC 20 uM). SEM revealed morphological changes in MRSA after treatment.Toxicity: MTT assays: 10-100 uM, not toxic to HeLa cells.Structure:  CD spectra did not support a clear helical structure in SDS or TFE.
Literature Information.Author: Saraswat S, Chugh A.2023
Literature Information.Reference: Biochim Biophys Acta Biomembr. 2023 Nov 21:184255. doi: 10.1016/j.bbamem.2023.184255.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Engraulisin: A novel marine derived cell penetrating peptide with activity against drug resistant bacteria.
